dismissalText.commentary: Victor Nyauchi b Mustafizur Rahman 26 (31b 3x4 1x6) SR: 83.87

commentTextItems.html: makes room as he moves to the leg side, shows all the three stumps, has a wild swing and misses it, the ball crashes into the stumps and Bangladesh win.

commentPostTextItems.html: Bangladesh win by 105 runs. No. 10 and No. 11 are the top scorers for Zimbabwe, they put up a fight after they were 9 down for 83 runs. Ngarava and Nyuachi involved in the highest 10th wicket partnership for Zimbabwe, it was a treat to the eyes with some brilliant hitting. Zimbabwe were never in the game after they lost early wickets, all bowlers chipping in, Mustafizur Raham taking 4 wickets. It was a great series for Zimbabwe, some really close contests. Afif is the Player of the Match. Sikandar Raza is the Player of the Series. Thanks for tuning in, it has been a pleasure bringing you this Series. That's it from us, on behalf of Thilak and Ranjith, this is Binoy George signing off.
JOYDEEPSINGHGIL: "What a memorable series this has been for Zimbabwe and especially for Sikandar Raza in Odis"

commentTextItems.html: down the track to a wider delivery and gets the edge along the ground to thirdman.
times it well square on the off side.
dropped by Mushfiqur Rahim, full and wide, reaches out for it and gets the edge behind the wicket, a tough chance put down, diving to his left.
swings it in the air to the square leg fence. This is brilliant hitting.
down the track and hits to the sweeper cover.
opens up and looks to pull, there was some noise as ball passed the bat, loud appeal for a caught behind turned down, Bangladesh players unhappy.

milestones.description: Nyauchi and Ngarava's 68-run partnership is ZIM's highest for the 10th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 60 between Ian Nicolson and Masakadza

stories.title: Sikandar Raza pleased with Zimbabwe youngsters stepping up in absence of senior players
stories.seoTitle: Zim vs Ban 3rd ODI 2022 - Sikandar Raza pleased with Zimbabwe youngsters stepping up in absence of senior players
stories.summary: Zimbabwe handed ODI debuts to Victor Nyauchi, Brad Evans, Tony Munyonga and Clive Madande, as they beat Bangladesh 2-1
